SEARCH

Class ScreenManager

java.lang.Object
ScreenManager
public class ScreenManager extends Object
Represents the class that holds information on all the screens.

This class is responsible for global actions for the screens, such as timers and screen transitions.

  • Constructor Details

    • ScreenManager

      public ScreenManager(javafx.stage.Stage stage, TimeInformation timeInfo)
      Creates a new ScreenManager object.

      This is responsible for managing the screens in the game and their transitions. It also handles the timers for the pet's stats and stores global actions for the screens.

      Parameters:
      stage - The stage of the entire JavaFX application.

  • Method Details

    • addScreen

      public void addScreen(String name, javafx.scene.Scene scene, GameScene gameScene)
      Adds a new screen to the screen manager.

      This method removes any existing screen with the same name before adding the new one.

      Parameters:
      name - The name of the screen.
      scene - The JavaFX Scene object representing the screen.
      gameScene - The GameScene object representing the game scene associated with this screen.

    • switchTo

      public void switchTo(String name)
      Switches to a specific screen. Should only be called for non-gameplay screens.
      Parameters:
      name - The string name of the screen to switch to.

    • switchToNext

      public void switchToNext()
      Switches to the next screen, intended for arrow buttons. Should only be called for gameplay screens.

    • switchToPrevious

      public void switchToPrevious()
      Switches to the previous screen, intended for arrow buttons. Should only be called for gameplay screens.

    • transition

      public void transition(String scene, boolean happy)
      Switches to another screen with a delay to facilitate UI changes. Intended for gameplay screens.
      Parameters:
      scene - The name of the screen to switch to.
      happy - Whether the pet should enter the screen happy or not.
